column2: my girlfriend and I tried the omakase
column3: which came out to be $150 per person with tax. We were fed about 11 dishes including dessert
column5: only 2 of the dishes really stuck with me (one of them being the impeccable dessert). While I understand that Uchi is innovated in trying new dishes that combines Japanese elements with western ones
column6: the overall quality and quantity of the omakase fell short of spectacular. Considering the price tag
column7: the sushi tasted less than amazing compared to similar priced omakase at MF sushi
column8: which definitely blew me away. The freshness of the fish
column10: and the choice of dishes presented in the omakase just fell short of what I expected to be the best sushi experience in Houston.
